For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.description:

it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute
has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt
(the user can still change the file name if they want).

attributes.name: router-direction
attributes.description:

attributes.name: separator
attributes.description:

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:

The default fill is `"solid"` except inside of a toolbar, where the default is `"clear"`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the checkbox.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description: If `true`, the checkbox will visually appear as indeterminate.

attributes.name: justify
attributes.description:
How to pack the label and checkbox within a line.
`"start"`: The label and checkbox will appear on the left in LTR and
on the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label and checkbox will appear on the right in LTR and
on the left in RTL.
`"space-between"`: The label and checkbox will appear on opposite
ends of the line with space between the two elements.

attributes.name: label-placement
attributes.description:
Where to place the label relative to the checkbox.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the checkbox in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the checkbox in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").

attributes.name: legacy
attributes.description:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt checkboxes in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or have text in the default slot. As a result,
the `legacy` property should only be used as an escape hatch when you want to
avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.

Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value of the checkbox does not mean if it's checked or not, use the `checked`
property for that.

The value of a checkbox is analogous to the value of an `<input type="checkbox">`,
it's only used when the checkbox participates in a native `<form>`.

attributes.name: force-overscroll
attributes.description:
If `true` and the content does not cause an overflow scroll, the scroll interaction will cause a bounce.
If the content exceeds the bounds of ionContent, nothing will change.
Note, this does not disable the system bounce on iOS. That is an OS level setting.

attributes.name: fullscreen
attributes.description:
If `true`, the content will scroll behind the headers
and footers. This effect can easily be seen by setting the toolbar
to transparent.

attributes.name: scroll-events
attributes.description:
Because of performance reasons, ionScroll events are disabled by default, in order to enable them
and start listening from (ionScroll), set this property to `true`.

attributes.name: scroll-x
attributes.description: If you want to enable the content scrolling in the X axis, set this property to `true`.

attributes.name: scroll-y
attributes.description: If you want to disable the content scrolling in the Y axis, set this property to `false`.

attributes.name: cancel-text
attributes.description: The text to display on the picker's cancel button.

attributes.name: clear-text
attributes.description: The text to display on the picker's "Clear" button.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: day-values
attributes.description:
Values used to create the list of selectable days. By default
every day is shown for the given month. However, to control exactly which days of
the month to display, the `dayValues` input can take a number, an array of numbers, or
a string of comma separated numbers. Note that even if the array days have an invalid
number for the selected month, like `31` in February, it will correctly not show
days which are not valid for the selected month.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the datetime.

attributes.name: done-text
attributes.description: The text to display on the picker's "Done" button.

attributes.name: first-day-of-week
attributes.description:
The first day of the week to use for `ion-datetime`. The
default value is `0` and represents Sunday.

attributes.name: hour-cycle
attributes.description:
The hour cycle of the `ion-datetime`. If no value is set, this is
specified by the current locale.

attributes.name: hour-values
attributes.description:
Values used to create the list of selectable hours. By default
the hour values range from `0` to `23` for 24-hour, or `1` to `12` for 12-hour. However,
to control exactly which hours to display, the `hourValues` input can take a number, an
array of numbers, or a string of comma separated numbers.

attributes.name: locale
attributes.description:
The locale to use for `ion-datetime`. This
impacts month and day name formatting.
The `"default"` value refers to the default
locale set by your device.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description:
The maximum datetime allowed. Value must be a date string
following the
[ISO 8601 datetime format standard](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime),
`1996-12-19`. The format does not have to be specific to an exact
datetime. For example, the maximum could just be the year, such as `1994`.
Defaults to the end of this year.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description:
The minimum datetime allowed. Value must be a date string
following the
[ISO 8601 datetime format standard](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime),
such as `1996-12-19`. The format does not have to be specific to an exact
datetime. For example, the minimum could just be the year, such as `1994`.
Defaults to the beginning of the year, 100 years ago from today.

attributes.name: minute-values
attributes.description:
Values used to create the list of selectable minutes. By default
the minutes range from `0` to `59`. However, to control exactly which minutes to display,
the `minuteValues` input can take a number, an array of numbers, or a string of comma
separated numbers. For example, if the minute selections should only be every 15 minutes,
then this input value would be `minuteValues="0,15,30,45"`.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: month-values
attributes.description:
Values used to create the list of selectable months. By default
the month values range from `1` to `12`. However, to control exactly which months to
display, the `monthValues` input can take a number, an array of numbers, or a string of
comma separated numbers. For example, if only summer months should be shown, then this
input value would be `monthValues="6,7,8"`. Note that month numbers do *not* have a
zero-based index, meaning January's value is `1`, and December's is `12`.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description:
If `true`, multiple dates can be selected at once. Only
applies to `presentation="date"` and `preferWheel="false"`.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: prefer-wheel
attributes.description:
If `true`, a wheel picker will be rendered instead of a calendar grid
where possible. If `false`, a calendar grid will be rendered instead of
a wheel picker where possible.

A wheel picker can be rendered instead of a grid when `presentation` is
one of the following values: `"date"`, `"date-time"`, or `"time-date"`.

A wheel picker will always be rendered regardless of
the `preferWheel` value when `presentation` is one of the following values:
`"time"`, `"month"`, `"month-year"`, or `"year"`.

attributes.name: presentation
attributes.description:
Which values you want to select. `"date"` will show
a calendar picker to select the month, day, and year. `"time"`
will show a time picker to select the hour, minute, and (optionally)
AM/PM. `"date-time"` will show the date picker first and time picker second.
`"time-date"` will show the time picker first and date picker second.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If `true`, the datetime appears normal but is not interactive.

attributes.name: show-clear-button
attributes.description:
If `true`, a "Clear" button will be rendered alongside
the default "Cancel" and "OK" buttons at the bottom of the `ion-datetime`
component. Developers can also use the `button` slot
if they want to customize these buttons. If custom
buttons are set in the `button` slot then the
default buttons will not be rendered.

attributes.name: show-default-buttons
attributes.description:
If `true`, the default "Cancel" and "OK" buttons
will be rendered at the bottom of the `ion-datetime`
component. Developers can also use the `button` slot
if they want to customize these buttons. If custom
buttons are set in the `button` slot then the
default buttons will not be rendered.

attributes.name: show-default-time-label
attributes.description:
If `true`, the default "Time" label will be rendered
for the time selector of the `ion-datetime` component.
Developers can also use the `time-label` slot
if they want to customize this label. If a custom
label is set in the `time-label` slot then the
default label will not be rendered.

attributes.name: show-default-title
attributes.description:
If `true`, a header will be shown above the calendar
picker. This will include both the slotted title, and
the selected date.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
If `cover`, the `ion-datetime` will expand to cover the full width of its container.
If `fixed`, the `ion-datetime` will have a fixed width.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value of the datetime as a valid ISO 8601 datetime string.
This should be an array of strings only when `multiple="true"`.

attributes.name: year-values
attributes.description:
Values used to create the list of selectable years. By default
the year values range between the `min` and `max` datetime inputs. However, to
control exactly which years to display, the `yearValues` input can take a number, an array
of numbers, or string of comma separated numbers. For example, to show upcoming and
recent leap years, then this input's value would be `yearValues="2024,2020,2016,2012,2008"`.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: datetime
attributes.description:
The ID of the `ion-datetime` instance
associated with the datetime button.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the button.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: activated
attributes.description:
If `true`, both the `ion-fab-button` and all `ion-fab-list` inside `ion-fab` will become active.
That means `ion-fab-button` will become a `close` icon and `ion-fab-list` will become visible.

attributes.name: edge
attributes.description:
If `true`, the fab will display on the edge of the header if
`vertical` is `"top"`, and on the edge of the footer if
it is `"bottom"`. Should be used with a `fixed` slot.

attributes.name: horizontal
attributes.description: Where to align the fab horizontally in the viewport.

attributes.name: vertical
attributes.description: Where to align the fab vertically in the viewport.

attributes.name: activated
attributes.description: If `true`, the fab button will be show a close icon.

attributes.name: close-icon
attributes.description:
The icon name to use for the close icon. This will appear when the fab button
is pressed. Only applies if it is the main button inside of a fab containing a
fab list.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the fab button.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to
it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute
has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt
(the user can still change the file name if they want).

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

attributes.name: router-direction
attributes.description:
When using a router, it specifies the transition direction when navigating to
another page using `href`.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: If `true`, the fab button will show when in a fab-list.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The size of the button. Set this to `small` in order to have a mini fab button.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
Special keywords: `"_blank"`, `"_self"`, `"_parent"`, `"_top"`.

attributes.name: translucent
attributes.description:
If `true`, the fab button will be translucent.
Only applies when the mode is `"ios"` and the device supports
[`backdrop-filter`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#Browser_compatibility).

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button.

attributes.name: activated
attributes.description: If `true`, the fab list will show all fab buttons in the list.

attributes.name: side
attributes.description: The side the fab list will show on relative to the main fab button.

attributes.name: collapse
attributes.description:
Describes the scroll effect that will be applied to the footer.
Only applies in iOS mode.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: translucent
attributes.description:
If `true`, the footer will be translucent.
Only applies when the mode is `"ios"` and the device supports
[`backdrop-filter`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#Browser_compatibility).

Note: In order to scroll content behind the footer, the `fullscreen`
attribute needs to be set on the content.

attributes.name: fixed
attributes.description: If `true`, the grid will have a fixed width based on the screen size.

attributes.name: collapse
attributes.description:
Describes the scroll effect that will be applied to the header.
Only applies in iOS mode.

Typically used for [Collapsible Large Titles](https://ionicframework.com/docs/api/title#collapsible-large-titles)

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: translucent
attributes.description:
If `true`, the header will be translucent.
Only applies when the mode is `"ios"` and the device supports
[`backdrop-filter`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#Browser_compatibility).

Note: In order to scroll content behind the header, the `fullscreen`
attribute needs to be set on the content.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description:
This attribute defines the alternative text describing the image.
Users will see this text displayed if the image URL is wrong,
the image is not in one of the supported formats, or if the image is not yet downloaded.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: The image URL. This attribute is mandatory for the `` element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
If `true`, the infinite scroll will be hidden and scroll event listeners
will be removed.

Set this to true to disable the infinite scroll from actively
trying to receive new data while scrolling. This is useful
when it is known that there is no more data that can be added, and
the infinite scroll is no longer needed.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
The position of the infinite scroll element.
The value can be either `top` or `bottom`.

attributes.name: threshold
attributes.description:
The threshold distance from the bottom
of the content to call the `infinite` output event when scrolled.
The threshold value can be either a percent, or
in pixels. For example, use the value of `10%` for the `infinite`
output event to get called when the user has scrolled 10%
from the bottom of the page. Use the value `100px` when the
scroll is within 100 pixels from the bottom of the page.

attributes.name: loading-spinner
attributes.description: An animated SVG spinner that shows while loading.

attributes.name: loading-text
attributes.description:
Optional text to display while loading.
`loadingText` can accept either plaintext or HTML as a string.
To display characters normally reserved for HTML, they
must be escaped. For example `<Ionic>` would become
`<Ionic>`

For more information: [Security Documentation](https://ionicframework.com/docs/faq/security)

This property accepts custom HTML as a string.
Content is parsed as plaintext by default.
`innerHTMLTemplatesEnabled` must be set to `true` in the Ionic config
before custom HTML can be used.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: This attribute is ignored.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Indicates whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: Whether auto correction should be enabled when the user is entering/editing the text value.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.name: clear-input
attributes.description: If `true`, a clear icon will appear in the input when there is a value. Clicking it clears the input.

attributes.name: clear-on-edit
attributes.description: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit. Defaults to `true` when `type` is `"password"`, `false` for all other types.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: counter
attributes.description: If `true`, a character counter will display the ratio of characters used and the total character limit. Developers must also set the `maxlength` property for the counter to be calculated correctly.

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionInput` event after each keystroke.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

attributes.name: error-text
attributes.description: Text that is placed under the input and displayed when an error is detected.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description:
The fill for the item. If `"solid"` the item will have a background. If
`"outline"` the item will be transparent with a border. Only available in `md` mode.

attributes.name: helper-text
attributes.description: Text that is placed under the input and displayed when no error is detected.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The visible label associated with the input.

attributes.name: label-placement
attributes.description:
Where to place the label relative to the input.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the input in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the input in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"floating"`: The label will appear smaller and above the input when the input is focused or it has a value. Otherwise it will appear on top of the input.
`"stacked"`: The label will appear smaller and above the input regardless even when the input is blurred or has no value.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").

attributes.name: legacy
attributes.description:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the `label` property. As a result,
the `legacy` property should only be used as an escape hatch when you want to
avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum value, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum value, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: If the value of the type attribute is `text`, `email`, `search`, `password`, `tel`, or `url`, this attribute specifies the minimum number of characters that the user can enter.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: If `true`, the user can enter more than one value. This attribute applies when the type attribute is set to `"email"`, otherwise it is ignored.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: A regular expression that the value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. Use the title attribute to describe the pattern to help the user. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, `"date"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored. When the type attribute is `"date"`, `pattern` will only be used in browsers that do not support the `"date"` input type natively. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/date for more information.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
Instructional text that shows before the input has a value.
This property applies only when the `type` property is set to `"email"`,
`"number"`, `"password"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"text"`, or `"url"`, otherwise it is ignored.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot modify the value.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: If `true`, the user must fill in a value before submitting a form.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: The shape of the input. If "round" it will have an increased border radius.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The initial size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of the type attribute is `"text"` or `"password"`, in which case it is an integer number of characters. This attribute applies only when the `type` attribute is set to `"text"`, `"search"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`, `"email"`, or `"password"`, otherwise it is ignored.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: If `true`, the element will have its spelling and grammar checked.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description:
Works with the min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a value can be set.
Possible values are: `"any"` or a positive floating point number.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of control to display. The default type is text.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the input.

attributes.name: button
attributes.description: If `true`, a button tag will be rendered and the item will be tappable.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: counter
attributes.description: If `true`, a character counter will display the ratio of characters used and the total character limit. Only applies when the `maxlength` property is set on the inner `ion-input` or `ion-textarea`.

attributes.name: detail
attributes.description:
If `true`, a detail arrow will appear on the item. Defaults to `false` unless the `mode`
is `ios` and an `href` or `button` property is present.

attributes.name: detail-icon
attributes.description: The icon to use when `detail` is set to `true`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the item.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to
it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute
has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt
(the user can still change the file name if they want).

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description:
The fill for the item. If `"solid"` the item will have a background. If
`"outline"` the item will be transparent with a border. Only available in `md` mode.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

attributes.name: lines
attributes.description: How the bottom border should be displayed on the item.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

attributes.name: router-direction
attributes.description:
When using a router, it specifies the transition direction when navigating to
another page using `href`.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description:
The shape of the item. If "round" it will have increased
border radius.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
Special keywords: `"_blank"`, `"_self"`, `"_parent"`, `"_top"`.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button. Only used when an `onclick` or `button` property is present.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: sticky
attributes.description:
When it's set to `true`, the item-divider will stay visible when it reaches the top
of the viewport until the next `ion-item-divider` replaces it.

This feature relies in `position:sticky`:
https://caniuse.com/#feat=css-sticky

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the item option.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to
it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute
has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt
(the user can still change the file name if they want).

attributes.name: expandable
attributes.description: If `true`, the option will expand to take up the available width and cover any other options.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
Special keywords: `"_blank"`, `"_self"`, `"_parent"`, `"_top"`.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button.

attributes.name: side
attributes.description: The side the option button should be on. Possible values: `"start"` and `"end"`. If you have multiple `ion-item-options`, a side must be provided for each.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the sliding item.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: The position determines where and how the label behaves inside an item.

attributes.name: inset
attributes.description: If `true`, the list will have margin around it and rounded corners.

attributes.name: lines
attributes.description: How the bottom border should be displayed on all items.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: lines
attributes.description: How the bottom border should be displayed on the list header.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the loading indicator will animate.

attributes.name: backdrop-dismiss
attributes.description: If `true`, the loading indicator will be dismissed when the backdrop is clicked.

attributes.name: css-class
attributes.description:
Additional classes to apply for custom CSS. If multiple classes are
provided they should be separated by spaces.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before dismissing the loading indicator.

attributes.name: is-open
attributes.description:
If `true`, the loading indicator will open. If `false`, the loading indicator will close.
Use this if you need finer grained control over presentation, otherwise
just use the loadingController or the `trigger` property.
Note: `isOpen` will not automatically be set back to `false` when
the loading indicator dismisses. You will need to do that in your code.

attributes.name: keyboard-close
attributes.description: If `true`, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description:
Optional text content to display in the loading indicator.

This property accepts custom HTML as a string.
Content is parsed as plaintext by default.
`innerHTMLTemplatesEnabled` must be set to `true` in the Ionic config
before custom HTML can be used.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: show-backdrop
attributes.description: If `true`, a backdrop will be displayed behind the loading indicator.

attributes.name: spinner
attributes.description: The name of the spinner to display.

attributes.name: translucent
attributes.description:
If `true`, the loading indicator will be translucent.
Only applies when the mode is `"ios"` and the device supports
[`backdrop-filter`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#Browser_compatibility).

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
An ID corresponding to the trigger element that
causes the loading indicator to open when clicked.

attributes.name: content-id
attributes.description:
The `id` of the main content. When using
a router this is typically `ion-router-outlet`.
When not using a router, this is typically
your main view's `ion-content`. This is not the
id of the `ion-content` inside of your `ion-menu`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the menu is disabled.

attributes.name: max-edge-start
attributes.description:
The edge threshold for dragging the menu open.
If a drag/swipe happens over this value, the menu is not triggered.

attributes.name: menu-id
attributes.description: An id for the menu.

attributes.name: side
attributes.description: Which side of the view the menu should be placed.

attributes.name: swipe-gesture
attributes.description: If `true`, swiping the menu is enabled.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The display type of the menu.
Available options: `"overlay"`, `"reveal"`, `"push"`.

attributes.name: auto-hide
attributes.description: Automatically hides the menu button when the corresponding menu is not active

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the menu button.

attributes.name: menu
attributes.description: Optional property that maps to a Menu's `menuId` prop. Can also be `start` or `end` for the menu side. This is used to find the correct menu to toggle

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button.

attributes.name: auto-hide
attributes.description:
Automatically hides the content when the corresponding menu is not active.

By default, it's `true`. Change it to `false` in order to
keep `ion-menu-toggle` always visible regardless the state of the menu.

attributes.name: menu
attributes.description:
Optional property that maps to a Menu's `menuId` prop.
Can also be `start` or `end` for the menu side.
This is used to find the correct menu to toggle.

If this property is not used, `ion-menu-toggle` will toggle the
first menu that is active.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the modal will animate.

attributes.name: backdrop-breakpoint
attributes.description:
A decimal value between 0 and 1 that indicates the
point after which the backdrop will begin to fade in
when using a sheet modal. Prior to this point, the
backdrop will be hidden and the content underneath
the sheet can be interacted with. This value is exclusive
meaning the backdrop will become active after the value
specified.

attributes.name: backdrop-dismiss
attributes.description: If `true`, the modal will be dismissed when the backdrop is clicked.

attributes.name: can-dismiss
attributes.description:
Determines whether or not a modal can dismiss
when calling the `dismiss` method.

If the value is `true` or the value's function returns `true`, the modal will close when trying to dismiss.
If the value is `false` or the value's function returns `false`, the modal will not close when trying to dismiss.

attributes.name: handle
attributes.description:
The horizontal line that displays at the top of a sheet modal. It is `true` by default when
setting the `breakpoints` and `initialBreakpoint` properties.

attributes.name: handle-behavior
attributes.description:
The interaction behavior for the sheet modal when the handle is pressed.

Defaults to `"none"`, which  means the modal will not change size or position when the handle is pressed.
Set to `"cycle"` to let the modal cycle between available breakpoints when pressed.

Handle behavior is unavailable when the `handle` property is set to `false` or
when the `breakpoints` property is not set (using a fullscreen or card modal).

attributes.name: initial-breakpoint
attributes.description:
A decimal value between 0 and 1 that indicates the
initial point the modal will open at when creating a
sheet modal. This value must also be listed in the
`breakpoints` array.

attributes.name: is-open
attributes.description:
If `true`, the modal will open. If `false`, the modal will close.
Use this if you need finer grained control over presentation, otherwise
just use the modalController or the `trigger` property.
Note: `isOpen` will not automatically be set back to `false` when
the modal dismisses. You will need to do that in your code.

attributes.name: keep-contents-mounted
attributes.description:
If `true`, the component passed into `ion-modal` will
automatically be mounted when the modal is created. The
component will remain mounted even when the modal is dismissed.
However, the component will be destroyed when the modal is
destroyed. This property is not reactive and should only be
used when initially creating a modal.

Note: This feature only applies to inline modals in JavaScript
frameworks such as Angular, React, and Vue.

attributes.name: keyboard-close
attributes.description: If `true`, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: show-backdrop
attributes.description:
If `true`, a backdrop will be displayed behind the modal.
This property controls whether or not the backdrop
darkens the screen when the modal is presented.
It does not control whether or not the backdrop
is active or present in the DOM.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
An ID corresponding to the trigger element that
causes the modal to open when clicked.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the nav should animate the transition of components.

attributes.name: root
attributes.description: Root NavComponent to load

attributes.name: swipe-gesture
attributes.description: If the nav component should allow for swipe-to-go-back.

attributes.name: component
attributes.description: Component to navigate to. Only used if the `routerDirection` is `"forward"` or `"root"`.

attributes.name: router-direction
attributes.description: The transition direction when navigating to another page.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the picker will animate.

attributes.name: backdrop-dismiss
attributes.description: If `true`, the picker will be dismissed when the backdrop is clicked.

attributes.name: css-class
attributes.description:
Additional classes to apply for custom CSS. If multiple classes are
provided they should be separated by spaces.

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before dismissing the picker.

attributes.name: is-open
attributes.description:
If `true`, the picker will open. If `false`, the picker will close.
Use this if you need finer grained control over presentation, otherwise
just use the pickerController or the `trigger` property.
Note: `isOpen` will not automatically be set back to `false` when
the picker dismisses. You will need to do that in your code.

attributes.name: keyboard-close
attributes.description: If `true`, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: show-backdrop
attributes.description: If `true`, a backdrop will be displayed behind the picker.

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
An ID corresponding to the trigger element that
causes the picker to open when clicked.

attributes.name: alignment
attributes.description:
Describes how to align the popover content with the `reference` point.
Defaults to `"center"` for `ios` mode, and `"start"` for `md` mode.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the popover will animate.

attributes.name: arrow
attributes.description:
If `true`, the popover will display an arrow that points at the
`reference` when running in `ios` mode. Does not apply in `md` mode.

attributes.name: backdrop-dismiss
attributes.description: If `true`, the popover will be dismissed when the backdrop is clicked.

attributes.name: component
attributes.description:
The component to display inside of the popover.
You only need to use this if you are not using
a JavaScript framework. Otherwise, you can just
slot your component inside of `ion-popover`.

attributes.name: dismiss-on-select
attributes.description:
If `true`, the popover will be automatically
dismissed when the content has been clicked.

attributes.name: event
attributes.description: The event to pass to the popover animation.

attributes.name: is-open
attributes.description:
If `true`, the popover will open. If `false`, the popover will close.
Use this if you need finer grained control over presentation, otherwise
just use the popoverController or the `trigger` property.
Note: `isOpen` will not automatically be set back to `false` when
the popover dismisses. You will need to do that in your code.

attributes.name: keep-contents-mounted
attributes.description:
If `true`, the component passed into `ion-popover` will
automatically be mounted when the popover is created. The
component will remain mounted even when the popover is dismissed.
However, the component will be destroyed when the popover is
destroyed. This property is not reactive and should only be
used when initially creating a popover.

Note: This feature only applies to inline popovers in JavaScript
frameworks such as Angular, React, and Vue.

attributes.name: keyboard-close
attributes.description: If `true`, the keyboard will be automatically dismissed when the overlay is presented.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: reference
attributes.description:
Describes what to position the popover relative to.
If `"trigger"`, the popover will be positioned relative
to the trigger button. If passing in an event, this is
determined via event.target.
If `"event"`, the popover will be positioned relative
to the x/y coordinates of the trigger action. If passing
in an event, this is determined via event.clientX and event.clientY.

attributes.name: show-backdrop
attributes.description:
If `true`, a backdrop will be displayed behind the popover.
This property controls whether or not the backdrop
darkens the screen when the popover is presented.
It does not control whether or not the backdrop
is active or present in the DOM.

attributes.name: side
attributes.description:
Describes which side of the `reference` point to position
the popover on. The `"start"` and `"end"` values are RTL-aware,
and the `"left"` and `"right"` values are not.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description:
Describes how to calculate the popover width.
If `"cover"`, the popover width will match the width of the trigger.
If `"auto"`, the popover width will be determined by the content in
the popover.

attributes.name: translucent
attributes.description:
If `true`, the popover will be translucent.
Only applies when the mode is `"ios"` and the device supports
[`backdrop-filter`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#Browser_compatibility).

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.description:
An ID corresponding to the trigger element that
causes the popover to open. Use the `trigger-action`
property to customize the interaction that results in
the popover opening.

attributes.name: trigger-action
attributes.description:
Describes what kind of interaction with the trigger that
should cause the popover to open. Does not apply when the `trigger`
property is `undefined`.
If `"click"`, the popover will be presented when the trigger is left clicked.
If `"hover"`, the popover will be presented when a pointer hovers over the trigger.
If `"context-menu"`, the popover will be presented when the trigger is right
clicked on desktop and long pressed on mobile. This will also prevent your
device's normal context menu from appearing.

attributes.name: buffer
attributes.description:
If the buffer and value are smaller than 1, the buffer circles will show.
The buffer should be between [0, 1].

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: reversed
attributes.description: If true, reverse the progress bar direction.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The state of the progress bar, based on if the time the process takes is known or not.
Default options are: `"determinate"` (no animation), `"indeterminate"` (animate from left to right).

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value determines how much of the active bar should display when the
`type` is `"determinate"`.
The value should be between [0, 1].

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the radio.

attributes.name: justify
attributes.description:
How to pack the label and radio within a line.
`"start"`: The label and radio will appear on the left in LTR and
on the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label and radio will appear on the right in LTR and
on the left in RTL.
`"space-between"`: The label and radio will appear on opposite
ends of the line with space between the two elements.

attributes.name: label-placement
attributes.description:
Where to place the label relative to the radio.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the radio in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the radio in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").

attributes.name: legacy
attributes.description:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the default slot that contains
the label text. As a result, the `legacy` property should only be used as
an escape hatch when you want to avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: the value of the radio.

attributes.name: allow-empty-selection
attributes.description: If `true`, the radios can be deselected.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: the value of the radio group.

attributes.name: active-bar-start
attributes.description:
The start position of the range active bar. This feature is only available with a single knob (dualKnobs="false").
Valid values are greater than or equal to the min value and less than or equal to the max value.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description:
How long, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the
`ionInput` event after each change in the range value.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the range.

attributes.name: dual-knobs
attributes.description: Show two knobs.

attributes.name: label-placement
attributes.description:
Where to place the label relative to the range.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the range in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the range in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").

attributes.name: legacy
attributes.description:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the `label` property. As a result,
the `legacy` property should only be used as an escape hatch when you want to
avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Maximum integer value of the range.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Minimum integer value of the range.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: pin
attributes.description:
If `true`, a pin with integer value is shown when the knob
is pressed.

attributes.name: snaps
attributes.description:
If `true`, the knob snaps to tick marks evenly spaced based
on the step property value.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Specifies the value granularity.

attributes.name: ticks
attributes.description:
If `true`, tick marks are displayed based on the step value.
Only applies when `snaps` is `true`.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: the value of the range.

attributes.name: close-duration
attributes.description:
Time it takes to close the refresher.
Does not apply when the refresher content uses a spinner,
enabling the native refresher.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the refresher will be hidden.

attributes.name: pull-factor
attributes.description:
How much to multiply the pull speed by. To slow the pull animation down,
pass a number less than `1`. To speed up the pull, pass a number greater
than `1`. The default value is `1` which is equal to the speed of the cursor.
If a negative value is passed in, the factor will be `1` instead.

For example: If the value passed is `1.2` and the content is dragged by
`10` pixels, instead of `10` pixels the content will be pulled by `12` pixels
(an increase of 20 percent). If the value passed is `0.8`, the dragged amount
will be `8` pixels, less than the amount the cursor has moved.

Does not apply when the refresher content uses a spinner,
enabling the native refresher.

attributes.name: pull-max
attributes.description:
The maximum distance of the pull until the refresher
will automatically go into the `refreshing` state.
Defaults to the result of `pullMin + 60`.
Does not apply when  the refresher content uses a spinner,
enabling the native refresher.

attributes.name: pull-min
attributes.description:
The minimum distance the user must pull down until the
refresher will go into the `refreshing` state.
Does not apply when the refresher content uses a spinner,
enabling the native refresher.

attributes.name: snapback-duration
attributes.description:
Time it takes the refresher to snap back to the `refreshing` state.
Does not apply when the refresher content uses a spinner,
enabling the native refresher.

attributes.name: pulling-icon
attributes.description:
A static icon or a spinner to display when you begin to pull down.
A spinner name can be provided to gradually show tick marks
when pulling down on iOS devices.

attributes.name: pulling-text
attributes.description:
The text you want to display when you begin to pull down.
`pullingText` can accept either plaintext or HTML as a string.
To display characters normally reserved for HTML, they
must be escaped. For example `<Ionic>` would become
`<Ionic>`

For more information: [Security Documentation](https://ionicframework.com/docs/faq/security)

Content is parsed as plaintext by default.
`innerHTMLTemplatesEnabled` must be set to `true` in the Ionic config
before custom HTML can be used.

attributes.name: refreshing-spinner
attributes.description: An animated SVG spinner that shows when refreshing begins

attributes.name: refreshing-text
attributes.description:
The text you want to display when performing a refresh.
`refreshingText` can accept either plaintext or HTML as a string.
To display characters normally reserved for HTML, they
must be escaped. For example `<Ionic>` would become
`<Ionic>`

For more information: [Security Documentation](https://ionicframework.com/docs/faq/security)

Content is parsed as plaintext by default.
`innerHTMLTemplatesEnabled` must be set to `true` in the Ionic config
before custom HTML can be used.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the reorder will be hidden.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Sets the type of ripple-effect:

- `bounded`: the ripple effect expands from the user's click position
- `unbounded`: the ripple effect expands from the center of the button and overflows the container.

NOTE: Surfaces for bounded ripples should have the overflow property set to hidden,
while surfaces for unbounded ripples should have it set to visible.

attributes.name: component
attributes.description:
Name of the component to load/select in the navigation outlet (`ion-tabs`, `ion-nav`)
when the route matches.

The value of this property is not always the tagname of the component to load,
in `ion-tabs` it actually refers to the name of the `ion-tab` to select.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description:
Relative path that needs to match in order for this route to apply.

Accepts paths similar to expressjs so that you can define parameters
in the url /foo/:bar where bar would be available in incoming props.

attributes.name: from
attributes.description:
A redirect route, redirects "from" a URL "to" another URL. This property is that "from" URL.
It needs to be an exact match of the navigated URL in order to apply.

The path specified in this value is always an absolute path, even if the initial `/` slash
is not specified.

attributes.name: to
attributes.description:
A redirect route, redirects "from" a URL "to" another URL. This property is that "to" URL.
When the defined `ion-route-redirect` rule matches, the router will redirect to the path
specified in this property.

The value of this property is always an absolute path inside the scope of routes defined in
`ion-router` it can't be used with another router or to perform a redirection to a different domain.

Note that this is a virtual redirect, it will not cause a real browser refresh, again, it's
a redirect inside the context of ion-router.

When this property is not specified or his value is `undefined` the whole redirect route is noop,
even if the "from" value matches.

attributes.name: root
attributes.description:
The root path to use when matching URLs. By default, this is set to "/", but you can specify
an alternate prefix for all URL paths.

attributes.name: use-hash
attributes.description:
The router can work in two "modes":
- With hash: `/index.html#/path/to/page`
- Without hash: `/path/to/page`

Using one or another might depend in the requirements of your app and/or where it's deployed.

Usually "hash-less" navigation works better for SEO and it's more user friendly too, but it might
requires additional server-side configuration in order to properly work.

On the other side hash-navigation is much easier to deploy, it even works over the file protocol.

By default, this property is `true`, change to `false` to allow hash-less URLs.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

attributes.name: router-direction
attributes.description:
When using a router, it specifies the transition direction when navigating to
another page using `href`.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
Special keywords: `"_blank"`, `"_self"`, `"_parent"`, `"_top"`.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the router-outlet should animate the transition of components.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, enable searchbar animation.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Set the input's autocomplete property.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: Set the input's autocorrect property.

attributes.name: cancel-button-icon
attributes.description:
Set the cancel button icon. Only applies to `md` mode.
Defaults to `arrow-back-sharp`.

attributes.name: cancel-button-text
attributes.description: Set the the cancel button text. Only applies to `ios` mode.

attributes.name: clear-icon
attributes.description: Set the clear icon. Defaults to `close-circle` for `ios` and `close-sharp` for `md`.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionInput` event after each keystroke.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the input.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
Set the input's placeholder.
`placeholder` can accept either plaintext or HTML as a string.
To display characters normally reserved for HTML, they
must be escaped. For example `<Ionic>` would become
`<Ionic>`

For more information: [Security Documentation](https://ionicframework.com/docs/faq/security)

attributes.name: search-icon
attributes.description:
The icon to use as the search icon. Defaults to `search-outline` in
`ios` mode and `search-sharp` in `md` mode.

attributes.name: show-cancel-button
attributes.description:
Sets the behavior for the cancel button. Defaults to `"never"`.
Setting to `"focus"` shows the cancel button on focus.
Setting to `"never"` hides the cancel button.
Setting to `"always"` shows the cancel button regardless
of focus state.

attributes.name: show-clear-button
attributes.description:
Sets the behavior for the clear button. Defaults to `"focus"`.
Setting to `"focus"` shows the clear button on focus if the
input is not empty.
Setting to `"never"` hides the clear button.
Setting to `"always"` shows the clear button regardless
of focus state, but only if the input is not empty.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: If `true`, enable spellcheck on the input.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Set the type of the input.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: the value of the searchbar.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the segment.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: scrollable
attributes.description:
If `true`, the segment buttons will overflow and the user can swipe to see them.
In addition, this will disable the gesture to drag the indicator between the buttons
in order to swipe to see hidden buttons.

attributes.name: select-on-focus
attributes.description:
If `true`, navigating to an `ion-segment-button` with the keyboard will focus and select the element.
If `false`, keyboard navigation will only focus the `ion-segment-button` element.

attributes.name: swipe-gesture
attributes.description: If `true`, users will be able to swipe between segment buttons to activate them.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: the value of the segment.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the segment button.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description: Set the layout of the text and icon in the segment.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of the button.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the segment button.

attributes.name: cancel-text
attributes.description: The text to display on the cancel button.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

This property is only available when using the modern select syntax.

attributes.name: compare-with
attributes.description: A property name or function used to compare object values

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the select.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description:
The fill for the item. If `"solid"` the item will have a background. If
`"outline"` the item will be transparent with a border. Only available in `md` mode.

attributes.name: interface
attributes.description: The interface the select should use: `action-sheet`, `popover` or `alert`.

attributes.name: interface-options

Any additional options that the `alert`, `action-sheet` or `popover` interface
can take. See the [ion-alert docs](./alert), the
[ion-action-sheet docs](./action-sheet) and the
[ion-popover docs](./popover) for the
create options for each interface.

Note: `interfaceOptions` will not override `inputs` or `buttons` with the `alert` interface.

attributes.name: justify
attributes.description:
How to pack the label and select within a line.
`justify` does not apply when the label and select
are on different lines when `labelPlacement` is set to
`"floating"` or `"stacked"`.
`"start"`: The label and select will appear on the left in LTR and
on the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label and select will appear on the right in LTR and
on the left in RTL.
`"space-between"`: The label and select will appear on opposite
ends of the line with space between the two elements.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The visible label associated with the select.

attributes.name: label-placement
attributes.description:
Where to place the label relative to the select.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the select in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the select in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"floating"`: The label will appear smaller and above the select when the select is focused or it has a value. Otherwise it will appear on top of the select.
`"stacked"`: The label will appear smaller and above the select regardless even when the select is blurred or has no value.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").
When using `"floating"` or `"stacked"` we recommend initializing the select with either a `value` or a `placeholder`.

attributes.name: legacy
attributes.description:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the `label` property. As a result,
the `legacy` property should only be used as an escape hatch when you want to
avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: If `true`, the select can accept multiple values.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name of the control, which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: ok-text
attributes.description: The text to display on the ok button.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The text to display when the select is empty.

attributes.name: selected-text
attributes.description: The text to display instead of the selected option's value.

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: The shape of the select. If "round" it will have an increased border radius.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value of the select.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the select option. This property does not apply when `interface="action-sheet"` as `ion-action-sheet` does not allow for disabled buttons.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The text value of the option.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the skeleton text will animate.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description: Duration of the spinner animation in milliseconds. The default varies based on the spinner.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The name of the SVG spinner to use. If a name is not provided, the platform's default
spinner will be used.

attributes.name: paused
attributes.description: If `true`, the spinner's animation will be paused.

attributes.name: content-id
attributes.description:
The `id` of the main content. When using
a router this is typically `ion-router-outlet`.
When not using a router, this is typically
your main view's `ion-content`. This is not the
id of the `ion-content` inside of your `ion-menu`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the split pane will be hidden.

attributes.name: when
attributes.description:
When the split-pane should be shown.
Can be a CSS media query expression, or a shortcut expression.
Can also be a boolean expression.

attributes.name: component
attributes.description: The component to display inside of the tab.

attributes.name: tab
attributes.description:
A tab id must be provided for each `ion-tab`. It's used internally to reference
the selected tab or by the router to switch between them.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: selected-tab
attributes.description: The selected tab component

attributes.name: translucent
attributes.description:
If `true`, the tab bar will be translucent.
Only applies when the mode is `"ios"` and the device supports
[`backdrop-filter`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/backdrop-filter#Browser_compatibility).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the tab button.

attributes.name: download
attributes.description:
This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to
it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute
has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt
(the user can still change the file name if they want).

attributes.name: href
attributes.description:
Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to.
If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

attributes.name: layout
attributes.description:
Set the layout of the text and icon in the tab bar.
It defaults to `"icon-top"`.

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object.
The value is a space-separated list of [link types](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types).

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: The selected tab component

attributes.name: tab
attributes.description:
A tab id must be provided for each `ion-tab`. It's used internally to reference
the selected tab or by the router to switch between them.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Specifies where to display the linked URL.
Only applies when an `href` is provided.
Special keywords: `"_blank"`, `"_self"`, `"_parent"`, `"_top"`.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: mode
attributes.description: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

attributes.name: auto-grow
attributes.description:
If `true`, the textarea container will grow and shrink based
on the contents of the textarea.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description:
Indicates whether and how the text value should be automatically capitalized as it is entered/edited by the user.
Available options: `"off"`, `"none"`, `"on"`, `"sentences"`, `"words"`, `"characters"`.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: This Boolean attribute lets you specify that a form control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.name: clear-on-edit
attributes.description: If `true`, the value will be cleared after focus upon edit.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

attributes.name: cols
attributes.description: The visible width of the text control, in average character widths. If it is specified, it must be a positive integer.

attributes.name: counter
attributes.description:
If `true`, a character counter will display the ratio of characters used and the total character limit.
Developers must also set the `maxlength` property for the counter to be calculated correctly.

attributes.name: debounce
attributes.description: Set the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait to trigger the `ionInput` event after each keystroke.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If `true`, the user cannot interact with the textarea.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which enter key to display.
Possible values: `"enter"`, `"done"`, `"go"`, `"next"`,
`"previous"`, `"search"`, and `"send"`.

attributes.name: error-text
attributes.description: Text that is placed under the textarea and displayed when an error is detected.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description:
The fill for the item. If `"solid"` the item will have a background. If
`"outline"` the item will be transparent with a border. Only available in `md` mode.

attributes.name: helper-text
attributes.description: Text that is placed under the textarea and displayed when no error is detected.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description:
A hint to the browser for which keyboard to display.
Possible values: `"none"`, `"text"`, `"tel"`, `"url"`,
`"email"`, `"numeric"`, `"decimal"`, and `"search"`.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The visible label associated with the textarea.

attributes.name: label-placement
attributes.description:
Where to place the label relative to the textarea.
`"start"`: The label will appear to the left of the textarea in LTR and to the right in RTL.
`"end"`: The label will appear to the right of the textarea in LTR and to the left in RTL.
`"floating"`: The label will appear smaller and above the textarea when the textarea is focused or it has a value. Otherwise it will appear on top of the textarea.
`"stacked"`: The label will appear smaller and above the textarea regardless even when the textarea is blurred or has no value.
`"fixed"`: The label has the same behavior as `"start"` except it also has a fixed width. Long text will be truncated with ellipses ("...").

attributes.name: legacy
attributes.description:
Set the `legacy` property to `true` to forcibly use the legacy form control markup.
Ionic will only opt components in to the modern form markup when they are
using either the `aria-label` attribute or the default slot that contains
the label text. As a result, the `legacy` property should only be used as
an escape hatch when you want to avoid this automatic opt-in behavior.
Note that this property will be removed in an upcoming major release
of Ionic, and all form components will be opted-in to using the modern form markup.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of characters that the user can enter.

attributes.name: minlength

attributes.name: required

attributes.name: size

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: If `true`, the toast will animate.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
